info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 09 at 10:24AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM MST /3 PM PDT/ THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by multiple rounds of excessive rainfall. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Arizona, southeast California and southern Nevada, including the following areas, in northwest Arizona, Lake Havasu and Fort Mohave, Lake Mead National Recreation Area and Northwest Deserts. In southeast California, Cadiz Basin, Eastern Mojave Desert, Morongo Basin, San Bernardino County-Upper Colorado River Valley and Western Mojave Desert. In southern Nevada, Lake Mead National Recreation Area and Southern Clark County. * WHEN...From 3 PM MST /3 PM PDT/ this afternoon through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff from multiple rounds of moderate to heavy rainfall may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Multiple rounds of thunderstorms are possible this afternoon through Saturday night which will be capable of moderate to heavy rainfall. Rainfall totals of up to 1 inch will be possible with some locally higher amounts possible. Highest amounts are expected in the Morongo Basin area where 1 to 2 inches will be possible, especially for Morongo Valley, Yucca Valley, and Joshua Tree. Flooding of State Road 62 and secondary roads in the area will be the main concern overnight tonight and again Saturday afternoon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood http://www.weather.gov/vegas
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued and ensure that you have multiple ways to receive warnings.
